intro: Momisia brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved momisia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Momisia brevifolia is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
